lines.text: [last lines]
[Torrey and Sergeant, in car, outside church]
Nothing changes, only the names.
You gotta be kidding. We're chest deep in water. Screaming against the rushing tide.
[Vescari goes into confessional in church, having organized murder of other Dons]
Bless me, Father, for I have sinned. I haven't been to confession for ten days... I lose my temper
[in car]
You know, last three weeks, in New York City alone, there were 159 homicides?
[in confessional]
I don't mean to be harsh, but I struck my son in anger last Tuesday.
3,000 criminal assaults, 6,000 robberies.
Ruth, my wife, bless her, I swore at her.
You multiply that by Chicago, Boston, Philadelphia, Los Angeles.
For these, and all the other sins which I cannot remember, forgive me.
You remember that cartoon of an old Roman Circus, where all the lions are roaring, and the page boy yells down the corridor...
[to camera]
You've got five minutes, Christians.
Don't hit me! I'll have you up on charges!
Who hit you? I wouldn't do a thing like that.
[punches Jumper in the face]
You said when, Jumper?
What's a nice guy like you want with the 4th Precinct house?
They give a good massage and a quick piece of ass.

[sees Lipper's corpse]
What hit him?

[unemotionally]
A complete state of death.
Lionel Henry Jumper?
No. I just do impersonations.
We'll try one more time. Lionel Henry...
Yes!

[sees Matthews]
You sure keep lousy company, man.
Hey, I filled your plate for you.
That's cool. Say Torrey, I still don't wanna marry your sister.

[smiling]
That breaks me up. You wanna see the slob she did marry.

[smiling]
Some little pig should have stayed home.
